name: T-Perm
description: Use when: Two adjacent corners need to swap AND two adjacent edges need to swap (both on the same side). Look for a side where the two corner colors match ('headlights') but the edge between them is wrong. Hold that side facing you. One of the most important PLL algorithms.
algorithm: R U R' U' R' F R2 U' R' U' R U R' F'
setupMoves: F R U' R' U R U R2 F' R U R U' R'

steps.label: R U R' U': Setup — keeps yellow on top while moving the front-right corner and the right edge into position for the swap. Watch the two corner stickers that match on the front ('headlights') — they stay in place
R' F R2: Break into the front face — this disrupts the front-right corner and its adjacent edge, beginning the swap. The mismatched edge (between the headlights) starts moving to its correct position
U' R' U' R U: Cycle the pieces back through the top layer — the two corners that need to swap are now exchanging positions, and the two edges are also swapping
R' F': Close the front face — the two adjacent corners are now swapped and the two adjacent edges are swapped. Each side should now have all matching colors

name: Ja-Perm
description: Use when: Two adjacent corners need to swap and two adjacent edges need to swap (similar to T-perm but a different swap pattern). Look for a 1x1x3 solved block (three pieces in a row on one side). Hold the solved block on the LEFT side.
algorithm: R' U L' U2 R U' R' U2 R L
setupMoves: L' R' U2 R U R' U2 L U' R

steps.label: R' U L': Bridge the right and left layers — this reaches across to grab a corner from the left side and a corner from the right side simultaneously, starting the swap between them
U2 R: Double-turn the top and lift right — the first corner moves to its new position. Watch the side colors: the corner that was on the right is now traveling to the left
U' R' U2: Rotate top, lower right, double-turn again — the second corner completes its swap. The two adjacent edges also exchange positions during this sequence
R L: Close both layers together — the bridge is restored, locking both swapped corners and edges into their correct positions. The solved 1x1x3 block (three matching pieces) should now be on the left

name: Y-Perm
description: Use when: No two adjacent corners share matching colors on ANY side (no headlights anywhere). This means the two corners that need to swap are DIAGONAL. Apply from any angle -- it swaps diagonal corners and fixes the edges.
algorithm: F R U' R' U' R U R' F' R U R' U' R' F R F'
setupMoves: F R' F' R U R U' R' F R U' R' U R U R' F'

steps.label: F: Open the front face — prepares to access the diagonal corners (front-right and back-left) that need to swap
R U' R' U' R U R': Twist sequence — swaps the front-right corner with the back-left corner diagonally. Watch the side sticker colors: corners that didn't match any neighbor now start pairing up
F': Close the front face — locks in the first diagonal corner swap
R: Transition — lifts the right layer to set up access to the edges that also need to swap
U R' U' R' F R F': Second swap sequence — fixes the edges that were disrupted by the corner swap. The front and right edges exchange positions so all four side colors now match
R' F R F': Close and restore — completes the permutation. Every side now has a uniform color with yellow still on top

name: Ua-Perm
description: Use when: All corners are solved (every side has matching corner colors) and three edges need to cycle CLOCKWISE. One side will be fully solved -- hold it at the BACK. The three visible front edges cycle to the right.
algorithm: R U' R U R U R U' R' U' R2
setupMoves: R2 U R U R' U' R' U' R' U R'

steps.label: R: Lift the right layer — starts displacing the front-right edge so it can enter the clockwise cycle

U' R U R U R U' R' U': Cycle three edges clockwise — the front edge moves to the right side, the right edge moves to the left side, and the left edge moves to the front. Watch the edge sticker colors rotate one position to the right around the top
R2: Close and restore — locks all three edges into their new positions. Each side now has a matching color strip all the way across (corners + edge), solving the cube

name: Ub-Perm
description: Use when: All corners are solved and three edges need to cycle COUNTER-CLOCKWISE. One side will be fully solved -- hold it at the BACK. The three visible front edges cycle to the left. This is the mirror of Ua.
algorithm: R2 U R U R' U' R' U' R' U R'
setupMoves: R U' R U R U R U' R' U' R2

steps.label: R2: Double-turn the right layer — starts displacing the front-right edge so it can enter the counter-clockwise cycle

U R U R' U' R' U' R' U: Cycle three edges counter-clockwise — the front edge moves to the left side, the left edge moves to the right side, and the right edge moves to the front. Watch the edge sticker colors rotate one position to the left around the top
R': Close and restore — locks all three edges into their new positions. Each side now has a matching color strip all the way across, solving the cube

name: H-Perm
description: Use when: All corners are solved but two PAIRS of opposite edges need to swap (front-back and left-right). Every side will show the edge color not matching its corners. Apply from any angle -- the pattern is symmetrical.
algorithm: R2 U2 R U2 R2 U2 R2 U2 R U2 R2
setupMoves: R2 U2 R' U2 R2 U2 R2 U2 R' U2 R2

steps.label: R2 U2 R: Start the first edge swap — the front edge and back edge begin exchanging positions. Watch the front edge color disappear to the back and the back edge color come forward
U2 R2: Transition — rotate the top 180° and align the right layer. This pivots to target the left and right edges (the second pair that needs to swap)
U2 R2 U2: Swap the second pair — the left edge and right edge exchange positions. Now both pairs of opposite edges have been swapped
R U2 R2: Restore — bring the right layer back to its solved position. All four sides now have matching colors across corners and edges, solving the cube
